item.name: db[current_scn]
item.description: system change delta, useful for activity comparisons

trigger.name: no SCN increase since {$ZBXDB_SCN_INCREASE}
trigger.description: SCN's are not increasing since {$ZBXDB_SCN_INCREASE}. Is this a standby database? Check redo transport and redo apply.

item.name: db[last_patch_hist]
item.description: last patch action in the registry

trigger.name: fra loop snel vol(<4h)
trigger.description: FRA fills up within 4 hours, based on 6 hours of data

trigger.name: fra zit vol
trigger.description: fra has less than 2% bruikbare usable space

item.name: zbxdb[connect_status]
item.description: 0 is OK, all others is ERROR_CODE for connect

trigger.name: zbxdb Connect nodata {HOSTNAME} since {$ZBXDB_NODATA}
trigger.description: no info received during a long period

trigger.name: zbxdb Connect {HOSTNAME} failed
trigger.description: Connect to database failed. Could be any thing from listener down to database down, account locked etc.

trigger.name: zbxdb connect {HOSTNAME} failed > 1h
trigger.description: Database is nog steeds niet bereikbaar.

trigger.name: zbxdb restarted
trigger.description: for some reason zbxdb has been restarted. Could be because of upgrade or server restart. Should be very, very infrequent. Check logs for reason. make this trigger depend from the host restart to prevent a gazillion events when this happens

trigger_prototype.name: asmVG {#ASMVOL} fills up in 14d
trigger_prototype.description: based on the data of last 7 or 14 days, this volume fills up within 14 days

trigger_prototype.name: acfs fs {#ACFS_FS} fills up within 14d
trigger_prototype.description: This fs seems to fill up within 14d, based on data of last 7 or 14 days

item_prototype.name: arl_dest[{#INST_NAME}_{#ARL_DEST}_status]
item_prototype.description: archive destination status

trigger_prototype.name: arl_dest[{#INST_NAME}_{#ARL_DEST}] ! VALID
trigger_prototype.description: ARL destination not in (VALID(0) and DEFERRED(1))

trigger_prototype.name: db{#PDB} in mount mode
trigger_prototype.description: PDB is mounted

item_prototype.name: dgrp[{#DGRP}_leftfree30d]
item_prototype.description: time left until depleted, using last 30d of data

item_prototype.name: dgrp[{#DGRP}_leftfree180d]
item_prototype.description: time left until depletion, based on last half year

trigger_prototype.expression: {timeleft(14d,,0)} < 100d and {timeleft(14d,,0)} < 2d or {timeleft(14d,,0)} >= 100d and ( {timeleft(7d,,0)} < 100d and {timeleft(7d,,0)} < 2d or {timeleft(7d,,0)} >= 100d and ( {timeleft(1d,,0)} < 100d and {timeleft(1d,,0)} < 2d or {timeleft(1d,,0)} >= 100d and ( {timeleft(6h,,0)} < 100d and {timeleft(6h,,0)} < 2d)))
trigger_prototype.name: dg[{#DGRP} fills up within 2d
trigger_prototype.description: Trying to warn before depletion occurs, despite sawtoot pattern. if based on last 14d < 2d or on last 7d < 2d or on last 1d < 2d or on last 6h < 2d timeleft, the trigger fires.

trigger_prototype.name: dg[{#DGRP} fills up within 14d
trigger_prototype.description: Trying to warn before depletion. if data of last 14d < 14d or if last 7d < 14d timeleft, the trigger fires.

dependency.name: dg[{#DGRP} fills up within 2d
dependency.expression: {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(14d,,0)} < 100d and {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(14d,,0)} < 2d or {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(14d,,0)} >= 100d and ( {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(7d,,0)} < 100d and {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(7d,,0)} < 2d or {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(7d,,0)} >= 100d and ( {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(1d,,0)} < 100d and {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(1d,,0)} < 2d or {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(1d,,0)} >= 100d and ( {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(6h,,0)} < 100d and {template zbxDB:dgrp[{#DGRP},pctfree].timeleft(6h,,0)} < 2d)))

trigger_prototype.name: dg[{#DGRP}_pctfree] < {$ZBXDB_ASM_PCTFREE_HIGH}
trigger_prototype.description: low space and changed in last week

trigger_prototype.name: dg[{#DGRP}_pctfree] < {$ZBXDB_ASM_PCTFREE_INFO}
trigger_prototype.description: low space and changing

trigger_prototype.name: dg[{#DGRP}_pctfree] < {$ZBXDB_ASM_PCTFREE_WARN}
trigger_prototype.description: pct free < warning level and current pct free < minimum pct free of a week ago

trigger_prototype.name: dg[{#DGRP}_pctfree] == 0
trigger_prototype.description: game over

item_prototype.name: expu[{#PDB}_{#USERNAME}_expiring]
item_prototype.description: days left before expiration takes place

trigger_prototype.name: account expiration {#PDB} {#USERNAME} in 1 week
trigger_prototype.description: and {template zbxDB:expu[{#PDB},{#USERNAME},expiring].nodata(2h)}=0

trigger_prototype.name: account expiration {#PDB} {#USERNAME} in 2 weeks
trigger_prototype.description:
acount to expire within 14 days, nodata when password has been changed.
and {template zbxDB:expu[{#PDB},#USERNAME},expiring].nodata(2h)}=0

trigger_prototype.name: account expiration {#PDB} {#USERNAME} in 5 days
trigger_prototype.description:
when password is reset, the user is no longer reported so the reset error should be on nodata
and {template zbxDB:expu[{#PDB},{#USERNAME},expiring].nodata(2h)}=0

item_prototype.name: inst[{#INST_NAME}_execute count]
item_prototype.description: number of executions, could be server call's, could be sql's ..... just to give an idea about what is happening over time

item_prototype.name: inst[{#INST_NAME}_log]
item_prototype.description: alert log name

item_prototype.name: inst[{#INST_NAME}_processes]
item_prototype.description: # of processes in use, should be less than processes parameter

item_prototype.name: inst[{#INST_NAME}_sessions]
item_prototype.description: sessions count

item_prototype.name: inst[{#INST_NAME}_uptime]
item_prototype.description: time since instance opened

item_prototype.name: inst[{#INST_NAME}_version]
item_prototype.description: version info is only collected at connection time (minutes=0) so only a few samples.

item_prototype.name: parm[{#INST_NAME}_{#PARAMETER}_value]
item_prototype.description: non default numeric parameters

item_prototype.name: p_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX_timeleft1d]
item_prototype.description: time left to depletion based on last day of measurements

item_prototype.name: p_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX_timeleft7d]
item_prototype.description: time to depletion based on last week of measurements

item_prototype.name: p_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX_timeleft14d]
item_prototype.description: time to depletion based on last 14 days of measurements

item_prototype.name: p_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX]
item_prototype.description: same as pctfree but based on max filesize

trigger_prototype.name: p_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}] fills up within 5d
trigger_prototype.description: Does the tablespace fill up within 5d? based on data of last 14d, last 7d or last day.

trigger_prototype.expression: {timeleft(14d,,0)} < 100d and {timeleft(14d,,0)} < 14d or {timeleft(14d,,0)} >= 100d and ( {timeleft(7d,,0)} < 100d and {timeleft(7d,,0)} < 7d or {timeleft(7d,,0)} >= 100d and ( {timeleft(1d,,0)} < 100d and {timeleft(1d,,0)} < 1d))
trigger_prototype.name: p_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}] fills up within 14d
trigger_prototype.description: Triggers when last 14d or last 7d timeleft has less than 7d, or last day timeleft has less than 1 day to go

trigger_prototype.name: p_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}] filling up
trigger_prototype.description: free space decreases and timeleft also decreases and timeleft less than 4d

trigger_prototype.name: p_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX]< {$ZBXDB_TS_HIGH}
trigger_prototype.description: TS grows since a week and hits HIGH alert treshhold

trigger_prototype.name: p_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX]< {$ZBXDB_TS_WARN}
trigger_prototype.description: TS is growing since last week and hits WARN level

discovery_rule.name: rman.lld
discovery_rule.description: rman backup info by object_type from v$rman_status

trigger_prototype.name: rman bkup {#OBJ_TYPE} {$ZBXDB_BKUP_AGE_FACTOR} * older than usual avg
trigger_prototype.description: try to report when last backup far over average age. Age is taken from last 30 days. Set macro {$ZBXDB_BKUP_AGE_FACTOR} to 0 if backups are not important for the given host

trigger_prototype.name: rman[{#OBJ_TYPE}].last bkup OUDer {$ZBXDB_BKUP_MAX_INCR_AGE}
trigger_prototype.description: backups ouder dan {$ZBXDB_BKUP_MAX_INCR_AGE} ..... wat klopt er niet?

trigger_prototype.name: rman[{#OBJ_TYPE}].last bkup failed
trigger_prototype.description:
set macro {$ZBXDB_BKUP_AGE_FACTOR} to 0 when backups are not of any importance.
Trigger fires immdiatly, not sent to standby: not fatal

trigger_prototype.name: objects[{#PDB}_{#SCHEMA}_INVALID_count] increased
trigger_prototype.description: invalid objects should not exist but certainly not increase

item_prototype.name: service[{#PDB}_{#INST_NAME}_{#SERVICE_NAME}_sess]
item_prototype.description: Sessions counted by database, instance, service.

item_prototype.name: service[{#PDB}_{#INST_NAME}_{#SERVICE_NAME}_slowestSQLage]
item_prototype.description: how long does the longest running SQL run that is running longer than the threshold.

item_prototype.name: service[{#PDB}_{#INST_NAME}_{#SERVICE_NAME}_slowqueries]
item_prototype.description: slow queries ..... very site and app specific

trigger_prototype.name: service[{#PDB}_{#INST_NAME}_{#SERVICE_NAME}_slowqueries]
trigger_prototype.description: slow queries ..... treshold is coded in the site specific SQL.

item_prototype.name: t_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX]
item_prototype.description: same as pctfree but based on max filesize

item_prototype.name: ustat[{#PDB}_{#STATUS}_count]
item_prototype.description: count per account_status

item_prototype.name: u_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX]
item_prototype.description: same as pctfree but based on max filesize

trigger_prototype.name: u_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX]< {$ZBXDB_TS_HIGH}
trigger_prototype.description: undo tablespace almost FULL

trigger_prototype.name: u_ts[{#PDB}_{#TS_NAME}_pctfreeMAX]< {$ZBXDB_TS_WARN}
trigger_prototype.description: undo tablespace is nearing depletion

discovery_rule.name: zbxdb queries
discovery_rule.description: queries found in the zbxdb checks file

item_prototype.name: query[{#SECTION}_{#KEY}_ela]
item_prototype.description: part of self health check; how long takes processing of a check section?

item_prototype.name: query[{#SECTION}_{#KEY}_status]
item_prototype.description: status of query execution, part of self health check 0 == OK, all others ERROR_CODE from database

trigger_prototype.name: zbxdb[query_{#SECTION}_{#KEY}] failed
trigger_prototype.description: could be due to anything, query syntax, lost connection, permissions etc.

trigger_prototype.name: zbxdb[query_{#SECTION}_{#KEY}] failed ORA-12850
trigger_prototype.description: COULD NOT ALLOCATE SLAVES ON ALL SPECIFIED INSTANCES

trigger_prototype.name: zbxdb[query_{#SECTION}_{#KEY}] shared pool vol (4031)
trigger_prototype.description: query heeft een probleem vanwege ora-4031, unable to allocate from shared pool

trigger_prototype.name: zbxdb[query_{#SECTION}_{#KEY}] user canceled
trigger_prototype.description: postgres cancel due to sql_timeout

discovery_rule.name: zbxdb sections
discovery_rule.description: sections found in the checks parameter file, kind of self discovery

item_prototype.name: section[query_{#SECTION}__ela]
item_prototype.description: time taken to process 1 section of checks

trigger.name: ASM disks not all CACHED
trigger.description: Could be a problems since normally all disks should be CACHED
